juzs.text: What are they wondering about
About the huge announcement
over which they are in disagreement
They will know
For sure they will know
Have We not made the earth a cradle
And the mountains as pegs
And We created you in pairs
And made your sleep to rest
And made the night a cover
And made the day for livelihood
And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]
And made [the sun] a glowing lamp
And sent down from the clouds pouring water
to produce with it grain, vegetation
and luxuriant gardens
The Day of Decision has been appointed
The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in droves
And the heavens are opened and becomes gateways
And the mountains are set in motion and will become a mirage
Hell has been lying in wait
to be a home for the oppressors
to stay in for a long, long time
They will not taste any coolness there or drink
except for boiling water and sizzling pus
An appropriate reward
They were not expecting to be held accountable
And utterly rejected Our verses
We have recorded everything in writing
So feel it, We will only increase your punishment
For those who were mindful of God there is a great achievement
gardens and grapevines
splendid, well matched spouses
and a full cup
There, they will hear no gossip or lies
A reward from your Lord, a fitting gift
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything between them, the Merciful-to-all.They will have no authority from Him to speak
On the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows. They will not speak except for those to whom the Merciful gives permission, and he will say what is right
That is the True Day; so whoever wills, may take now a way back to his Lord
We have warned you of an eminent punishment on the Day when a person will see what he has done, and the unbeliever will say, "I wish that I were dust
By those [stars] who rise only to sit
And move [in their orbits] steadily
And float [through space] smoothly
And yet some overtake [others] swiftly
Thus they fulfill the [Creator's] purpose
On the Day when the world will shudder
Followed by a tremor
Hearts, that Day, will shiver
and eyes are humbled
They say, "Are we to be restored to the original condition
After we have turned into decayed bones
They say, "This will be a losing come back
But all it will take is a single blast
and they will be awake and above ground
Has there the story of Moses reached you
When his Lord called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa
Go to Pharaoh. For he has transgressed
and ask him, "Would you be willing to purify yourself
And I will guide you to your Lord so you would be in awe of Him
And he showed him the greatest sign
but Pharaoh rejected the offer and disobeyed
Then he hastily turned away
and gathered [his people] and proclaimed
I am your lord, the most high
So God seized him with punishment, as an example, in the life to come as well as in this life
In this, there is a warning for whomever would fear [God]
Are you more difficult to create or is the heaven that He built
He raised it high and proportioned it
He darkened its night and brought out its morning light
After that He spread out the earth
From it, He produced its water and its pasture
And He set the mountains firmly in place
for you and for your animals to enjoy
But when the Great Calamity arrives
a Day when the human being will remember what he has done
and Hell will be there for all to see
for him who transgressed
and preferred the life of this world
Hell will be his home
But as for him who feared to stand one day in front of his Lord and therefore restrained himself from following his whims and desires
then Heaven will be home
They ask you about the Hour, "When will it take place
How can you possibly know that
Its time is only known to your Lord
You are only to warn those who dread it
On the Day they see it, it will seem as though they only stayed an evening or a morning
He frowned and turned away
when the blind man approached him
For all you know, he might be seeking to purify himself
or to be reminded and be helped by being reminded
As for him who was indifferent
you [Prophet] gave him your attention
Though it is not up to you whether or not he is purified
As for him who came to you eagerly
with God's fear in his heart
from him you are distracted
Indeed this is a reminder
So, whoever wills may remember it
it is [written] on honored sheets
Exalted and purified
by the hands of scribes
honorable and virtuous
How regretful it is for people to have so much self-destructive ingratitude
From what did He create him
From a fertilized ovum He created him and proportioned him
Then He eased the way for him
Then He causes him to die and to be buried
Then when He wills, He will resurrect him
No! He did not fulfill what He has commanded him
A human being has only to consider the food he eats
We poured down water in abundance
and caused the soil to break open
and grew grains in it
and grapes and legumes
olive and dates
and luxurious gardens
and fruits and vegetable
for you and your livestock to enjoy
But when the Deafening Blast comes
on the Day when a human being will flee from his brother
his mother, his father
his wife and his children
every one of them, on that Day, will have enough to preoccupy him
Faces on that Day will be beaming
laughing and rejoicing
And [other] faces, on that Day, will be covered with dust
overwhelmed by sorrow
These are the unbelievers, the wicked ones
When the sun folds
and the stars are dispersed
when the mountains are shifting
and when full-term she-camels are neglected
When the wild beasts are gathered
when the seas are set aflame
when the souls are paired
when the female baby who was buried alive is asked
for what sin she was killed
When the records are made public
when the sky is stripped away
when Hell is set ablaze
when Paradise is brought into view
every soul will then know what it has brought with it
I swear by the planets
the runners and sweepers
and by the night as it recedes
and the dawn when it breathes
this revelation is indeed the word of a honorable Messenger
endowed with strength, secure with the Lord of the Throne
obeyed and trustworthy
This fellow of yours is not mad
he has already seen him [Gabriel] in the clear horizon
He does not withhold what is revealed to him from beyond
And it (the Qur'an) is not the word of a devil, expelled from Heaven
So where, then, will you go
It is only a reminder to all humankind
for whoever wills among you to go straight
But you cannot will, unless God, the Lord of the worlds, so wills
When the heavens are torn apart
when the planets are sprinkled
when the oceans are exploded
when the graves are scattered
each soul will then know what it has sent on ahead and what it has left behind
People, what has lured you away from your Lord, the Most Generous
He Who created you, formed you, and proportioned you
In whatever shape He willed, He assembled you
Yet you still deny the Judgment
When guardians are standing over you
honorable recorders
They know everything you do
Indeed, the truly good will be in bliss
while the wicked will be in Hell
They will roast in it on the Day of Judgment
and will never get away from it
And how would you know what is the Day of Judgment
Truly, how would you know what is the Day of Judgment
It is the Day when no soul will be able to do anything for another soul; and the decision on that Day is God's alone
How terrible it is to those who give short measures
who, when they take a measure from people, take in full
But when they measure or weigh for others, they cheat
Don't such people realize that they will be resurrected
for a grievous Day
the Day when Humankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds
Indeed, the record of the wicked is in Sijjeen
And how would you know what Sijjeen is
It is a locked-in digital data record
How terrible it is that Day for the deniers
who deny the Day of Judgment
when only sinful aggressors deny it
When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of ancient people
Not at all! Rather, their hearts have become encrusted by what they were earning
They will be separated from their Lord, that Day
Then, they will be rekindling Hell
They will be then told, "This is what you used to deny
No indeed! The righteous' record is in 'Illiyyun
And how would you know what is Illiyyun
It is a digital data record
open to be witnessed by those brought near [to God]
Indeed, the righteous will be in perfect bliss
seated on couches, looking around
You will recognize the radiance of bliss on their faces
They will be given pure virgin nectar to drink
leaving a great taste in the mouth. Let people with aspirations, aspire to that
It is mixed with the water from Tasneem
a spring from which those near [to God] drink
Those who rejected the faith and severed their relation with God used to laugh at those who believed
They would wink at one another when the believers passed by them
joking about them when they returned to their people
And if they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost
Yet, they were not sent as guardians over them
So today those who believed will laugh at the unbelievers
while seated on luxurious furnishings, looking around
Have the unbelievers been rewarded for their deeds
When the sky is ruptured
obeying its Lord, as it is bound to do
When the earth is leveled out
and has cast out what is in it, and becomes empty
obeying its Lord as it is bound to do
O human being, you are laboring toward your Lord and you will meet Him
Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand
he will have an easy settlement
and will return to his family delighted
But, as for him who is given his record behind his back
he will cry out for destruction
and will rekindle the Blaze
He used to be happy among his family
He thought he would never return [to His Lord]
Yes he will! His Lord was always watching him
So I swear by the twilight glow
and the night and all it gathers
and the moon when it is full
you will move onward from stage to stage
So what is the matter with them that they do not believe
and when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not bow down [to God]
But the unbelievers say it is lies
but God knows best what they comprehend
So give them the news of a painful punishment
except for those who believe and do good deeds. They will have a never ending reward
By the heavens full of great constellations
by the promised Day
and by the witness and the witnessed
how terrible were the people of the trench
[using] fire supplied with fuel
while they sat around it
to watch what they were doing to the believers
The only reason they punish them was because they believed in God, the Almighty, the Praiseworthy
to whom belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. God, is Witness over all things
Those who persecute believing men and women, and have not repented afterwards, will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of Burning
Indeed, those who believe and do good deeds will have Gardens with rivers flowing through them. That is the great victory
Your Lord's punishment is truly severe
It is He who begins [Creation] and repeats it
He alone is Truly-Forgiving, All-Embracing in His love
The Glorious Lord of the Throne
Doer of whatever He wills
Has the story of the legions reached you
[those of] Pharaoh and Thamud
Yet those who denied the truth are persistent in denial
while God will encircle them from behind
This is indeed a Glorious Qur'an
in a Preserved Tablet
By the sky and the knocking star
what do you know about the knocking star
It is the piercing Star
there is no soul without a protector over it
So let the human being consider what he was created from
He was created from ejected fluid
emerging from the vicinity of the backbone and the ribs
Indeed, God is able to bring him [the human being] back to life
On a Day when secrets are disclosed
a human being will have no power or anyone to help him
By the sky and its cyclical system
and the earth which cracks open
indeed, this is a decisive statement
not to be taken lightly
They plot and scheme
but I am planning too
So bear with the unbelievers. Let them be for a while
Praise the limitless glory of your Lord's name, the Most High
Who created and proportioned
Who destined and [then] guided
He who brought out the green pasture
and then made it black stubble
We will make you recite, and you will not forget
except what God wills. He knows what is open to one's perception and what is hidden
And We will ease you toward the easy way
So, remind, if reminding helps
He who fears God will remember
But the most wicked will ignore it
He will kindle the greatest fire
where he will remain, neither dying nor living
Successful is he who purifies himself
and remembers to call on his Lord and pray
But you prefer this worldly life
whereas the Hereafter is better and more enduring
All this is can be found in the earlier Scriptures
the Scriptures of Abraham and Moses
Have you heard about the Overwhelming Event
Some faces, that Day, will be humbled
working hard and exhausted
They will kindle an intensely hot Fire
and will be given drinks from a boiling spring
They will have no food except from a thorny plant
that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger
Other faces, that day, will be peaceful
Well pleased with their endeavor
in an elevated Garden
where they will hear no idle talk
A flowing spring runs through it
Raised couches are placed there
cups put in place
cushions lined up
and carpets spread around
Don't they look at how the camels are created
at how the sky is raised
at how the mountains are erected
and at how the earth is spread out
So remind them, for you are but a reminder
You are not in control of them
But whoever turns away and rejects the truth
God will inflict him with the greatest punishment
To Us is their return
Then it is for Us to call them to account
By the daybreak
and by ten nights
by the even and the odd
and by the night as it recedes
is there not in [all] that an oath for a rational person
Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with Aad
with Iram of the pillars
whose like was never created in any land
with Thamud, those who carved the rocks in the valley
And with Pharaoh, of the stakes
All of them committed excesses in the lands
and spread much corruption there
So your Lord poured on them a scourge of punishment
Your Lord is always watchful
As for human being, whenever his Lord tests him, by honoring him, and blessing him, he says, "My Lord has honored me
But when He tries him, and restricts his provision for him, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me
Not at all! It is you who are not generous with the orphans
and you do not urge one another to feed the needy
you who devour the inheritance [of others] with obvious greed
and you who passionately love wealth
No indeed! When the earth is crushed, pounded and crushed
and your Lord comes with the angels, row after row
on that Day, Hell will be brought near. On that Day, the human being will remember, but what good will that be to him then
He will say, "I wish I had provided for this life to come
On that Day, none will punish as He punishes
And none will shackle as severely as He shackles
[To the righteous it will be said], "Tranquil soul
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him]
go in among My worshipers
and into My Garden
I swear by this town
and you [Prophet] are free to dwell in this town
And [I swear by] a father and his offspring
We have created human being for a life of hardship
Does he thinks that no one will have power over him
I have wasted much money," he says
Does he think that no one sees him
Have We not given him two eyes
And a tongue and two lips
and have shown him the two ways [of good and evil]
But he did not take the difficult path
And how would you know what is the difficult path
It is to free a slave
or to feed on a day of hunger
an orphaned relative
or a needy person in distress
Then to become one of those who believe and urge one another to endure and to urge each other to be compassionate
Those are the people of righteousness
But those who defy Our revelations are the people of despair
With the fire closing in above them
By the sun and its morning light
and the moon as it follows it
and the day when it reveals it
and the night when it conceals it
and the sky and He who built it
and the earth and He who spread it
and by the soul and He who proportioned it
and inspired it [with knowledge to distinguish] its wickedness and its righteousness
Successful is he who purifies it
and failing is he who corrupts it
In their overwhelming arrogance, the people of Thamud called the Messenger a liar
and allowed their most wicked to lead them
The Messenger of God said to them, "This is the she-camel of God, so let her drink
But they called him a liar, and hamstrung her. So their Lord destroyed them for their crime, and leveled it
He doesn't fear the consequence
By the night as it conceals
and the day when it reveals
and He who created the male and the female
your striving is indeed diverse
As for he who gives and is mindful of God
and believes in goodness
We will smooth his way toward all that is easy
But as for he who is stingy and considers himself self-sufficient
and denies goodness
We will ease him toward hardship
His wealth will not help him the least when he falls
Indeed, it is upon Us to guide you
And indeed, to Us belong the last life and this first life
so, I have warned you of a Blazing Fire
None will burn in it except the most wicked
who had rejected and turned away
But the one who was most mindful of God will be spared
who gives his wealth away to purify himself
not as payment for received favors
but only seeking the pleasure of his Lord, the Most High
He will be well pleased
By the morning light
and the night as it settles
your Lord did not abandon you, nor is He displeased
The life to come is better for you than this first life
And your Lord is sure to give you [so much], and you will be satisfied
Did He not find you orphaned, and shelter you
Did He not find you lost and guide you
Did He not find you impoverished and enrich you
So do not mistreat the orphan
and do not snub the one who asks for help
Instead proclaim the blessings of your Lord
Did We not relieve the tightness in your chest
and lift your burden
that weighed heavily on your back
and raised high your reputation
For truly, with hardship comes ease
Indeed, with hardship comes ease
So, when you are done, get ready for serious devotion
and focus all your attention on your Lord
By the fig and the olive
and [by] Mount Sinai
and [by] this secure city [Mecca]
We have certainly created the human being in the best of stature
Then We return him to the lowest of the low
except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have an uninterrupted reward
So, do you still deny this faith
Isn't God the most Just of Judges
Recite in the name of your Lord who created
created the human being from a clinging substance
Recite, and your Lord is the most generous
Who taught by the pen
He taught the human being that which he knew not
No! [But] indeed, the human being transgresses
because he sees himself self-sufficient
Indeed, to your Lord is the return
Have you seen the one who forbids
a servant from praying
Have you seen if he is on [the road of] guidance
Or enjoins righteousness
Have you seen if he rejects and turns away
Does he not know that God sees
No! If he doesn't stop, We will surely drag him by the forelock
a lying, sinning forelock
Then let him call his associates
We will call the angels of Hell
No! Do not obey him. But prostrate yourselves and draw near [to God]
We sent this [Qur'an] down during the Night of Decree
But how would you know what is the Night of Decree
The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months
During that Night, the angels and the Spirit descend by their Lord's authority for a variety of matters
There is peace that night until the coming of dawn
The unbelievers from among the people of the Book and the idolaters will continue to deny the truth until clear evidence is sent to them
a Messenger from God, reciting purified texts
containing valuable books
Those who were given the Scripture did not become divided until after they were given clear evidence
They were only asked to worship God alone, making their faith sincerely His, to keep up with prayer, and to pay the purifying alms, for that is the true religion
Those who reject the truth among the People of the Book and the idolaters, will suffer the Fire of Hell, to remain there eternally, forever. They are the worst of creatures
while those who believe and do good deeds are the best of creatures

Their reward is with their Lord: Gardens of Eden, graced with flowing streams, remaining in them timelessly, forever and ever. God is well pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. All this is for whoever stands in awe of his Lord
When the Earth is shaken by its [last] earthquake
and the Earth throws out its burdens
and the human being says: 'What is wrong with it
On that Day, it will impart its news
because your Lord has inspired it
On that Day, people will come forward, separated from one another, to be shown their deeds
So, whoever has done an atom's weight of good deeds will see it
and whoever has done an atom's weight of evil will see it
[I swear] by the charging breathless warhorses
striking sparks with their hooves
raiding at early dawn
raising a cloud of dust
and storming into the center collectively
the human being is ungrateful to his Lord
even though he is a witness to that
And he is fiercely in love with wealth
But does he not know that when what are in the graves are scattered
and the hearts' contents are retrieved
on that Day, their Lord is fully knowledgeable
The striking calamity
What is the striking calamity
And how would you know what is the striking calamity
It is the Day when the human beings will be like dispersed moths
and the mountains will be like fluffed up wool
and then, the one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds]
will have a pleasant life
but the one whose scales are light
his refuge will be an abyss
And what will convey to you what that is
a Raging Fire
Your greed for more has distracted you
until you go down to your graves
No, indeed you will soon know
Certainly you will soon know
Indeed, If you knew the knowledge of certainty
you would see Hell
then you would surely see it with the eye of certainty
And on that Day you will be asked about the pleasures you enjoyed
I swear by the Late Afternoon
the human being is surely, in a state of loss
Except for those who have believed and done good deeds and urged one another to the Truth and urged one another to patience
Woe to every scorning backbiter
who has amassed wealth and diversified it
thinking that his wealth will make him immortal
No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher
And what will convey to you what is the Crusher
It is the kindled Fire of God
reaching right into the hearts
it will engulf them
in extended columns
Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the army who had Elephants
Did He not utterly bring their perfect planning to nothing
And He sent birds in flocks against them
striking them with stones of hard clay
He made them like eaten straw
So that Quraysh remains secure
They are secure in their Winter and Summer journeys
Let them worship the Lord of this House
who has fed them after hunger, and made then safe after fear
Have you seen the one who denies this faith
For that is the one who drives the orphan away
and does not encourage the feeding of the poor
So woe to those who pray
but, who do not pay attention to their prayer
Those who make a show [of their deeds]
and withhold assistance to others
We have given you all that is good in abundance
so pray to your Lord and sacrifice for Him
Your enemy is the one who is cut off
Say: "You who deny the truth
I do not worship what you worship
and you do not worship what I worship
and I will never worship what you worship
Neither will you worship what I worship
You have your own religion, and I have mine
When God's victory has come, together with His conquest
and you see people embracing God's religion in multitudes
exult your Lord's glory, and praise Him, and ask for His forgiveness; for He is ever-accepting of repentance
Doomed are the hands of Abu Lahab, and he is doomed too
His wealth and all that he gained would not help him
He will burn in a fire strongly glowing
and his wife as well, the carrier of firewood
Around her neck is a rope of palm fiber
Say: "He is God who is Uniquely Singular
Who is Eternal, [the uncaused cause of all that exists]
Who has not given birth nor is He born
and there is no equivalent to Him
Say: "I seek refuge with the lord of the Daybreak
from the evil in that which He has created
and from the evil of the darkness when it settles
and from women who blow on knots
and from the evil of the envious when he envies
Say: "I seek refuge with the Lord of people
The King of people
The God of people
From the evil of the insidious whisperer
who whispers [evil] into the hearts of people
from among the jinn or people
